alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Lee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 31 at 6:12PM EDT until August 03 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Breathitt, Jackson, Lee and Owsley. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 611 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... McKee, Booneville, Scoville, Levi, Turin, Major, Endee, Pebworth, Chestnut Gap, Vincent, Southfork, Eversole, Travellers Rest, Blake, Lower Buffalo, Conkling, Sturgeon, Stay, Ida May and Delvinta.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
